Yes, I do have some advice on how to stick to a budget when it means missing out on social activities with friends in an expensive city. Here are some tips:

1. Be honest and open: It's important to be honest with your friends about your financial situation. They may not be aware of your budget constraints and may be more understanding if you explain why you need to make certain choices. 2. Be creative: Look for ways to socialize that don't require a lot of money. For example, instead of dining out, organize a potluck party at home. Or, instead of going to expensive events, suggest free outdoor activities like hiking, a picnic or visiting a park. 3. Plan ahead: If you know you have an upcoming social event that you want to attend, plan ahead and budget for it. You can either cut back on other expenses during that period, or set aside some money in advance to ensure you can afford it. 4. Offer alternatives: If your friends suggest an activity that is outside of your budget, suggest an alternative that is more affordable. For example, if they suggest going to a fancy restaurant, suggest a less expensive one or a different type of activity instead. 5. Be firm: Lastly, if you can't afford to participate in every social activity that your friends suggest, it's okay to say no. You don't have to sacrifice your financial security to keep up with your friends. Just remember they should understand and respect your decision.
